ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English throte, from Old English þrote, þrota (meaning 'throat, gullet'), from Proto-Germanic *þrutō. Cognate with Old Frisian throte and Middle Dutch strot.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The passage in the neck through which food and air pass; the front part of the neck.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 喉嚨；咽喉 (頸部內部食物和空氣通過的通道，或頸部的前方)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He felt a painful lump in his throat when he tried to swallow.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 當他試圖吞嚥時，感覺到喉嚨裡有一個疼痛的腫塊。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Used to refer to the voice or ability to speak/sing.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The opera singer strained her throat during the performance.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 這位歌劇演唱家在表演中使嗓子過度勞累了。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A narrow opening or passage, often referring to the neck of a container or an architectural feature.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 狹窄的入口；頸部；收縮部位 (如瓶子的頸部)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Debris collected at the throat of the pipe, causing a blockage.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 碎屑聚集在管道的收縮口處，造成了堵塞。
